title: ARA rules out Cromwell takeover bid
text:
Singaporean property giant ARA Asset Management is not working on a takeover bid for Cromwell Property Group.

After months of speculation and simmering tension between the pair, ARA has definitively finally ruled out any offer at least in the near term.

“ARA has no current intention to make a bid for Cromwell," an ARA spokesman told Street Talk when pressed on the matter on Wednesday.

Under ASIC's truth in takeovers policy, an unambiguous statement of that nature should prevent ARA making an offer for at least four months.

It's another twist in the Australian property sector's biggest bust-up and means ARA's move to get Ardent Leisure executive chairman Gary Weiss on to Cromwell's board would appear to be its No.1 priority.

It also means Cromwell is going to need to hurry up and line up a capital partner to settle on its acquisition of the Polish retail portfolio held by one of its managed funds, as part of a pre-emptive right. ARA isn't coming to save the day.
description: Singaporean property giant ARA Real Estate is not working on a takeover bid for Cromwell Property Group.
